marketNews.title: IMF revises global growth outlook for 2025 to 3.2% and lowers China 2024 outlook
marketNews.content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Tuesday, 22 October 2024, revised down its outlook for global economic growth in 2025 to 3.2%, which is 0.1 percentage point lower than the previous outlook released in July 2024. The outlook for global growth in 2024 remains unchanged at 3.2%. The IMF also lowered its projection for China's economic growth in 2024 to 4.8%, a reduction of 0.2 percentage point compared with the July 2024 outlook. The Fund projects that global growth over the next five years will average 3.1%, a level considered mediocre compared with the pre-pandemic period.

marketNews.title: US Treasury Secretary Yellen says China stimulus not yet significant for domestic demand
marketNews.content: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Tuesday that her side has not yet seen any new stimulus from China that would significantly boost domestic demand, which she described as a key factor for China to drive its economic growth. IMF Chief Economist Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas echoed the view, stating that China's fiscal stimulus so far lacks detail, and therefore the IMF did not incorporate it into its latest outlook. On 22 October, the IMF also revised down its outlook for China's 2024 growth to 4.8%, 0.2 percentage point lower than the July 2024 projection.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo calls for budget cuts, reduction of overseas trips and events
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto asked his ministers to review their budgets and cut ceremonial events and overseas travel in order to reduce costs. He said there should be no problem with a larger cabinet than under President Joko Widodo if the cabinet can achieve total expenditure efficiency. Prabowo also promised to reduce bureaucracy and bottlenecks, which investors fear could worsen given the current large number of ministries.

marketNews.title: Industry Minister Gumiwang announces draft regulation on domestic gas pricing
marketNews.content: Industry Minister Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita said he has written to President Prabowo Subianto to turn the draft government regulation on domestic natural gas into a formal government regulation. The draft regulation will become the legal basis for certain domestic gas price incentives (HGBT), which are set to expire at the end of 2024.

marketNews.title: Agriculture Minister Amran targets 1 million hectares of rice fields in first year of Prabowo administration
marketNews.content: Agriculture Minister Andi Amran Sulaiman said his ministry aims to cultivate 1 million hectares of rice fields in the first year of President Prabowo Subianto's administration. He mentioned that the program has already started in Merauke, Central Kalimantan, South Kalimantan, South Sumatra, Aceh and Jambi. The priority commodities for food self-sufficiency are rice and corn. Previously, President Prabowo was reported to plan to create 3 million hectares of agricultural area within five years.

tickerNews.title: UNVR: 3Q24 Performance Worsens, Below Expectations
tickerNews.content:
Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) recorded a significant decline in net profit to 543 billion rupiah, down 62% year-on-year (YoY) and 47% quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) in 3Q24. Consequently, net profit for the nine months ended 2024 (9M24) reached only 3 trillion rupiah, a 28% YoY decline, representing just 65% of the FY24 consensus estimate of 54 trillion rupiah. The weak net profit in 3Q24 was driven by lower revenue and weak margins.

- Revenue fell as volume weakened: UNVR revenue in 3Q24 was 8.4 trillion rupiah, down 18% YoY and 7% QoQ, mainly due to a sharp 16% YoY decline in domestic sales volume. Revenue for 9M24 declined 10% YoY to 27.4 trillion rupiah. Management attributed the revenue drop to three factors: (1) reduction of stock in major channels; (2) disrupted distributor sales because of unstable and non-harmonised pricing across channels; and (3) ongoing impact of the boycott.

- Operating profit margin collapsed: Operating profit margin fell sharply to 8.7% in 3Q24 (vs. 17.9% in 3Q23 and 14.6% in 2Q24). The margin compression was caused by (1) diseconomies of scale due to the significant volume decline; (2) transformation and/or restructuring initiatives that temporarily increased production costs; and (3) operating expense (OPEX) reduction that did not keep pace with revenue decline because advertising, research and promotion costs remained relatively high.

Guidance: Management expects the various initiatives—stock adjustments, pricing harmonisation and transformation—to start showing results only in the second half of 2025.

Key Takeaway: With the weak results, we expect consensus analysts to further cut UNVR performance estimates. In the past three months, FY24 net profit estimates have been reduced by 9%. The weak sales performance may be a positive signal for competitors such as Tempo Scan Pacific (TSPC). UNVR management disclosed that market share fell in 3Q24 to 34.9% by value (vs. 38.5% in 10M23 and 35.5% in 2Q24) and 28.4% by volume (vs. 31.7% in 10M23 and 29.0% in 2Q24).

tickerNews.title: BBCA: 9M24 Net Profit Up 12.8% YoY, Beats Expectations
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia (BBCA) reported net profit of 14.2 trillion rupiah in 3Q24, up 1.4% QoQ and 16.1% YoY. This resulted in a 9M24 net profit of 41.1 trillion rupiah, a 12.8% YoY increase, surpassing consensus estimates by reaching approximately 76% of the FY24 forecast of 54 trillion rupiah. The performance was supported by a 14.5% YoY increase in loan disbursement to 877 trillion rupiah. In 9M24, Net Interest Income rose 9.5% YoY to 61 trillion rupiah and Pre-Provision Operating Profit increased 14.6% YoY to 53 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: ARNA: 9M24 Net Profit Down 10% YoY, On Track with Turnaround Thesis
tickerNews.content: Arwana Citramulia (ARNA) posted net profit of 113 billion rupiah in 3Q24, up 15% QoQ but only 3% YoY, resulting in a 9M24 net profit of 316 billion rupiah, a 10% YoY decline (vs. 1H24 which fell 17% YoY). This equals 75% of Stockbit's FY24 estimate. The 3Q24 result shows the company is on track with our turnaround thesis as outlined in the Unboxing ARNA report, and we expect the trend to continue in 4Q24. Revenue in 3Q24 reached 700 billion rupiah, up 19% QoQ and 14% YoY, driven by an estimated 12% YoY increase in volume. Gross profit margin in 3Q24 was 34.6%, a rise of 160 basis points QoQ but a decline of 150 basis points YoY.

tickerNews.title: MLBI: 9M24 Net Profit Up 10% YoY, Strong Revenue Growth
tickerNews.content: Multi Bintang Indonesia (MLBI) reported net profit of 318 billion rupiah in 3Q24, up 33% QoQ and 35% YoY, leading to a 9M24 net profit of 763 billion rupiah, a 10% YoY increase. The profit growth in 3Q24 was driven by revenue growth of 29% QoQ and 22% YoY, which outpaced the increase in cost of goods sold (COGS) of 15% QoQ and 8% YoY, thereby improving all profit margins.

tickerNews.title: BREN: Plans to Expand Capacity to 1 GW by 2025 and 1.95 GW by 2030
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewable Energy (BREN) announced plans to increase its total capacity to 1 gigawatt (GW) by 2025 through development of existing assets, and to 1.95 GW by 2030 via greenfield projects, according to a public expose released on Tuesday, 22 October 2024. BREN currently has a capacity of 965 megawatts (MW), comprising 886 MW of geothermal power plants (PLTP) and 79 MW of wind power plants (PLTB). The company has budgeted US$346 million (approximately 5.3 trillion rupiah) over the next three years to add 104.6 MW of capacity.

tickerNews.title: HMSP: 3Q24 Volume Up 5.6% QoQ but Down 8.9% YoY, Market Share Slightly Higher
tickerNews.content: Philip Morris International (HMSP) reported that its Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna (HMSP) sales volume reached 20.7 billion sticks in 3Q24, up 5.6% QoQ but down 8.9% YoY. This resulted in a 9M24 volume of 60.5 billion sticks, a 4.6% YoY decline. Industry-wide cigarette volume in Indonesia was 75.5 billion sticks in 3Q24 (up 5% QoQ, down 3.3% YoY), reaching 221.4 billion sticks in 9M24, a 0.9% YoY increase. HMSP's market share was 27.4% in 3Q24 (vs. 27.3% in 2Q24 and 29% in 3Q23) and 27.3% for 9M24 (vs. 28.9% in 9M23). By product segment, HMSP's cigarette sales fell 5.3% YoY to 59.7 billion sticks in 9M24, while IQOS sales doubled to 0.8 billion sticks.

tickerNews.title: ADRO: RUPSLB Rescheduled to 18 November 2024
tickerNews.content: Adaro Energy Indonesia (ADRO) announced a change in the schedule of its rights issue (RUPSLB) from Friday, 15 November 2024 to Monday, 18 November 2024.

tickerNews.title: BNBR: Private Placement of 13.3 Billion New Shares at 64 Rupiah per Share
tickerNews.content: Bakrie & Brothers (BNBR) plans a private placement of 13.3 billion new shares at an execution price of 64 rupiah per share to convert debt of 855 billion rupiah. The corporate action aims to improve the company's capital structure and will dilute existing shareholders by 7.7%. Eurofa Capital Investment Inc. and Silvery Moon Investment Ltd. will each acquire a stake in the new shares, resulting in post-transaction ownership of 6.76% and 0.94% respectively. Neither entity previously held shares in BNBR. The plan will be discussed at the rights issue meeting on 28 November 2024.

tickerNews.title: PNBN: Clarifies Rumor About Maybank Acquisition Interest
tickerNews.content: Bank Pan Indonesia (PNBN) stated in a clarification to the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) that the rumor reported by Kontan about Maybank Malaysia's interest in acquiring PNBN at a valuation of 1.7 times price-to-book value did not originate from the company's management, and the company is unaware of the source and accuracy of the information. Previously, Reuters reported in early October 2024 that PNBN's controlling family, the Gunawan family, and major shareholder ANZ Group Holdings Ltd. were considering divesting their stakes. In September 2024, Bloomberg reported that potential buyers included banks from Japan and Malaysia.

tickerNews.title: PMMP: Tiga Makin Jaya Sells 45.3 Million Shares at Average 163.1 Rupiah
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Panca Mitra Multiperdana (PMMP), PT Tiga Makin Jaya, sold 45.3 million PMMP shares at an average price of 163.1 rupiah per share between 15 and 21 October 2024. The total transaction value was approximately 7.4 billion rupiah and was intended to fund operational needs. After the transaction, PT Tiga Makin Jaya's ownership in PMMP decreased from 36.8% to 35.1%.
